message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.ST

Reasoning: 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a family of cost-sensitive online classification algorithms with adaptive regularization and empirically validates their effectiveness and properties in extensive experiments. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a method to enhance the prediction performance of classification models by incorporating second-order information. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The proposed algorithms can be applied to online anomaly detection tasks from real-world domains, which may involve computer vision and pattern recognition. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper introduces the sketching technique into the algorithms to significantly accelerate the computational speed with quite slight performance loss. This technique may be related to data structures and algorithms. 
- cs.ST (Statistics): The paper discusses two well-known cost-sensitive metrics: (i) weighted sum of sensitivity and specificity and (ii) weighted misclassification cost, which may be related to statistics.
